Oh. Um, actually, I'm looking for...
Enzo. Yeah. I heard you. He's not here right now, but I am.
Caroline, what the hell are you doing with Sarah?
There! An appropriate question. Thank you for asking. As a matter of fact, I'm going to k*ll her. (Caroline hangs up, dropping the phone onto the bar)
Hey. Calm down. It's just me. He's not here. Bonnie, this is about my mom. Kai knows a lot of stuff about my mom.
I don't care. I told you I didn't want to see him again, and you did it anyway.
I know, but, Bonnie...
(interrupting) Was I unclear?
He just wanted to talk.
Now I want to talk. So listen.
I get that he hurt you.
I said listen! (She uses her magic against Damon)
Unh! (Damon clutches his chest)
I want you to feel what I felt.
Ow!

You were there (bl*od soaks through Damon's shirt from a wound that Bonnie made appear) the first time he hurt me, an arrow through the stomach, but you weren't there for what happened next, when he chased me through the hospital, (Damon gasps and groans) when he strangled me, (Bonnie uses her magic against him again; Damon chokes and grabs his throat) he drugged me, he tied me up, and he stuck me in a trunk, and then suddenly, he wants to be nice, huh, start over.
Bonnie.
Sound familiar? He lied, and then he stabbed he again! (She uses her magic against him again to make another wound)
Unh! (Damon clutches his stomach as bl*od pours out)

Then came the worst part because when it was all over he left me alone... (She says in tears) And I wish I could share what that feels like, but I can't. (She releases him, he gasps and coughs) I want you to get out.
Bonnie, I'm sorry.
(She screams at him in rage) Get out! (He leaves as she turns back to the fire)
Hey! I'm making margaritas. You want one?
Where's Sarah?
I see Stefan filled you in on his big secret.
Where is she, Caroline?
Not here. That would be stupid. (She says as she preps the glasses with salt) She's with Liam. Say hi! (She says looking over to Enzo's phone which is on speaker with Sarah's name flashing in)
(shaky and in a panic) Hello?
Sarah is helping Liam with his surgical k*ll.
Please! Please don't hurt me!
I don't want to do this! (He screams)
Duh. You're probably gonna get expelled and then found guilty of m*rder. That's why I compelled you to do what I wanted.
No, please! Please!
Look, Caroline. I'm sorry. I shouldn't have pushed you.
Obviously. I was pretty clear about that.
Look. I know that you can't feel it right now, Care, but if you k*ll Sarah, it's gonna haunt you forever. Trust me. I did it, and it sucks. (Caroline pours the margarita mix into the glasses)
I compelled a student to perform surgery on Stefan's niece, and you found a way to make this about you? God, you truly have a gift, Elena. (She laughs)
Look at me, Caroline. What do you want me to do? You want me to leave town, I'll leave town. I'll stay as far away from you as possible. Just please let her go.

That's the problem, Stefan. It doesn't really matter how far away you are. You're still you... Kind, loyal, (She puts little umbrellas into the margaritas) who with one look can convince me that I'm not crazy. That's the Stefan that I fell for, and that's the Stefan who can bring me back.
k*ll Sarah isn't gonna change that.
I know. That's why I'd rather just change you. Let go of that part of you, Stefan.
Caroline, what are you talking about?
If Stefan wants to save Sarah's life, (She raises up two glasses of margaritas) all he has to do is shut his humanity off. Why are you both looking at me like that? Do I need to repeat myself?
He is not turning his humanity off.
(Setting the glasses down on the bar) Elena, Stefan unleashed himself from you months ago. He can think for himself now.
It's not gonna happen, Caroline.
(Picking up the phone) Hey, Liam.
No! Please! No, no!
Cut out her spleen.
Caroline!
Relax. She can live without a spleen. You know, it's really the infection you should be worried about.
Please don't hurt me! No! No! No!
I'm so sorry. (She screams as Liam uses the scapel to cut against her skin, bl*od oozes out)
Hey, Liam. Remember that conversation we had earlier about being honest? Where are you?
Don't answer him, Liam.
Whitmore Medical.
Hey!
Please don't hurt me! (Liam slices her again with the scapel and she screams) Aah!
(To Elena) Go! Get Sarah out of there. (Elena vamp speeds away)
Good luck getting there in time.
How's it going, Liam?
(screaming) Please, Liam! No, no!
(His eyes are wide in terror) I think I'm gonna go into pediatrics.
You know what? I changed my mind. Leave the spleen. (Liam relaxes taking a breath) Let's be a little bit more symbolic.
(screaming) Please no!
Take out her heart.
Liam, you still with me?
I'm not in the mood for the preamble. Just tell me why my mom's stuck in 1903.
You're not bringing your mom back.
That's odd. (He says turning to face Kai) Sounds like you just asked me to k*ll you.
You requested a truncated version, so I respectfully jumped to the end.
(He gets up) And why aren't we bringing her back?
Because there are only two prison worlds in existence, mine, created in 1994, and the one created in 1903 for the sole purpose of locking up your mom and her closet full of crazy pants.
(enraged) You said we'd get her back!
(Calm) I'm telling you, as a semi-sane person, you really don't want that.
And I'm telling you as a vampire who eats people you really don't want to piss me off!
I'm trying to save your life.
Tell me how to get her back!
Your mom's a ripper, ok? She's a ripper. (Damon releases him, stunned) She turned in 1858, faked her death, went to Europe, where she went a little nuts.
(Whispers) No.
Bodies piled up, she moved, k*ll some more until she had to move again. They think 3,000 in total.
(Whispers) That's enough.

And for some reason, my coven made it their duty to stop her, so they cut her off at New York Harbor before she could tear through Manhattan. Granted... heh... By the time they got the ship, they found everybody dead. It was so gruesome they had to burn it there at the harbor.
I said that's enough! (He screams)
(quietly) I guess I should show myself out. (He leaves and Damon falls back onto the floor devastated by this revelation)
Hey. It's Jeremy. Leave a message.

Hey, Jeremy. It's Bonnie. It's a really long story, but I'm back. Uh, I had this whole plan to drive out to new Mexico and surprise you, I don't know, show up as one of the models in your drawing class or something. (She laughs) Um... listen, Jer. I'm not sure I'm still the same Bonnie you want to be with. That place changed me, and I don't know if I'm scared of myself or actually kind of like the new me. If it's ok with you, I think I'm just gonna figure me out, and then I promise to come visit you. I hope you're well. Ok. Bye, Jer. (She hangs up and looks at herself in the mirror, lifting up her shirt to look at her scars)
Aah! No! Please! (Liam cuts her shirt open) Liam! Liam, no! Aah!
You're marking it worse. You'll only make it worse.
You'll k*ll me! Liam, I'll die! Liam! (He shoves a cloth in her mouth to stop the screaming)
I never used one of these before. I'm so sorry. (Sarah screams)
You don't realize it, but this really does hurt me to watch. (She sighs) I'm pathetic. (Into her Phone) Liam, she stopped screaming. Is she...
I think she passed out.
(Sigh) k*ll her. Call me when it's done. (She hangs up the phone and shoves it in her back pocket)
(Stepping over him) Stefan's phone.
(Racing through the hospital hallways) Caroline, where are they?
Hey. You're gonna be a doctor, right? How long can one live without their heart? Maybe, like, 3 seconds tops? (Stefan gets to his feet)
She's gonna let her die, Elena.
I can't find them anywhere. We're running out of time! (Caroline turns to Stefan)
Bring me back.
What? Stefan, w-what do you mean? Bring you back from where?
Just remember to bring me back.
No. No. No, no, no, no. Stefan! No! Stefan, no!
(Looking at her phone) Stefan. No.
Oh, my God.
Elena, I'm so sorry. I don't know what I'm doing.
Just stop. (Elena bites into her wrist and feeds Sarah her bl*od)

(upset) I have to take out her heart. (Liam goes for Sarah's chest but Elena stops him by breaking both of his hands) Ah! (He grunts and falls to the ground; Elena continues to feed Sarah her bl*od until Sarah starts to cough and becomes concious again)
(relieved) No. It's ok. Everything's gonna be ok.
Hello.
(Out of breath) Stefan, hey. Thank God. I found her. I... She's gonna be ok.
Oh, really?
Stefan, are you ok?
Well, I will be in one second. (He takes a sip of his drink) Mmm. I really needed that.
Please don't tell me that you shut it off. (Stefan doesn't answer) Stefan, don't you dare tell me that you shut it off!
Ok. I won't. (He passes the phone to Caroline who is laying on the bar)
He shut it off. (She hangs up the phone and tosses it aside; she grins and Stefan drinks his margarita)
Who are you?
Who are you?
Oh, my God. That's my mother.
There are only two prison worlds in existence, mine and the one created in 1903 for locking up your mom and her closet full of crazy pants.
Tell me how to get her back!
Your mom's a ripper!
Meet the real Sarah Salvatore. I'm going to make her do things she'd never dream of doing until she begs me to make her a vampire.
I'm pregnant.
Marry me.
Yes.
My mom is dead, and I just need the pain to be gone.
If anyone tries to flip my humanity switch back on, I'll become your worst nightmare.
I like you.
Stop.
Come back.
What the hell are you doing with Sarah?
I'm going to k*ll her.
If Stefan wants to save Sarah's life, all he has to do is shut his humanity off.
Just remember to bring me back.
Stefan, don't you dare shut it off.
A hard knock life, isn't it?
Don't walk there. Ugh! (grabbing a mop) I just washed that.
My apologies, Cinderella. What are you doing?
Stefan and I had a moment. Things broke in the process, and now I'm returning the Scull Bar to the way we found it.
Uh, the whole point of flipping your humanity switch is that you don't care how you leave things.

(sighs) I go to school here, Enzo. I want to keep going to school here, and the second that I draw any suspicions -- break-ins, broken property, dead bodies -- people will try to interrupt my routine. Then I will end up rotting in a cell somewhere instead of what I should be doing, which is preparing for my audition tomorrow.
You, Caroline Forbes, vampire without humanity, auditioning for the school play?
Musical. And obviously, duh. I'm a drama major. And what are you doing here?
Find my Phone led me here, though it didn't explain why your stick little fingers needed it last night.
Because you're the only one with Sarah Salvatore's phone number.
Why'd you need Sarah's number?
To use her life as leverage to convince Stefan to shut his humanity switch off too.
(concerned) That's both clever and deeply unsettling. Tell me she's still alive.
She's alive, assuming she survived any infections resulting from Liam's amateur surgery.
(realizing his revenge plan won't work) Which means Stefan's humanity's a thing of the past.
Like I said, I will stop at nothing to maintain my routine, so I suggest that you stay away. Now if you don't mind, (hands Enzo the mop) I need to prepare for my audition.
How was the rave?
Oh, you know, loud, lame, rave-like.
Anything I should know or anything you'd like to talk about bro to bro?
Where do we keep our w*apon?
Pardon? (gets up)
Crossbows, Vervain grenades, all that hunter crap Jeremy was into? Ah! Yes! The throne.
Elena told on me. Shocker.
Not a good time for a humanity flip, brother. (Stefan breaks his hand and he drops the vervain syringe)
Do yourself a favor. Stay out of my way today.
Whoa, easy.
Where am I?
You're at Whitmore Medical Center. I'm Dr. Laughlin.
Last night...
You had a little too much to drink. A professor found you passed out on the quad.
I sort of remember that. It was like a spring break kickoff rave. (Jo nods and she starts to get up) I should get home.
Actually, I need you to sit tight. We need to look after you for a while. You lost a lot of fluids last night. Okay? (Sarah reluctantly lies back down and Jo leaves the room as Sarah checks her arm)
For the record, I am not okay with turning my hospital into a supernatural holding cell.

Okay, look. It's the first day of spring break. The campus is like a ghost town. Besides, we need to keep her out of harm's way until Elena's bl*od is out of her system. Unless, of course, you want to invite another Salvatore vampire to our wedding.
I'm starting to think eloping is the way to go.
Heh, yeah. Yeah, me too. (they kiss) Look, she's been compelled to forget last night. And soon, she'll be back at Duke, safe with no idea what happened and no one the wiser.
Huh, Duke. That's not bad. It's a little obnoxious but kind of in a cute way, you know? Little Duke.
Whoa. Wait. We're thinking baby names?
You haven't been?
No. I have! No. I have. I totally have.
Name one.
(tries to think) Josette Jr.
Get out of here. (she kisses him) I have rounds. (they walk in opposite directions)
Damon. What are you doing?

Looking for a... healthy outlet for my rage. (knocks down a lamp, shocking Elena) I haven't found it yet. Stefan without his humanity is one artery away from Stefan the ripper, and every day that goes by is one year of guilt waiting for him on the other side.

Yeah. Well, not to add to our growing pile of bad news, but we didn't just lose Stefan. We lost our chance to spark Caroline's humanity. Turns out he was her emotional trigger. (Damon offers her the poker) No thanks.
Well, take it away from me. Because I'm seconds away from using it on this. (grabs the video camera that Bonnie brought back from the prison world)
(takes the poker and sets it down) Who is that?
This... (shows Elena the camera) is Lillian Salvatore.
Your mother is alive? (takes the camera for a closer look)
Yep. Turns out she's been in a prison world snapshot of 1903 for over a century.
Your mother is alive.
Oh, yeah. Alive and well. Not in the pine box that I thought I buried her in in 1858. And apparently, she's a vampire and not just any kind of vampire either-
Damon, your mother is alive!
She's a ripper, Elena. Makes perfect sense. Stefan was always such a mama's boy.
How much of a mama's boy?
He would have hanged himself with mother's apron strings if it meant her approval. We both would. We loved her. She was our world.
What? No. No way.
This is our way to get Stefan back! You can't tell me that his mother isn't an emotional trigger.
Elena, this woman k*ll so many people that an entire coven of witches built her a permanent timeout! You don't fix one ripper problem by unleashing another ripper.
Think about it. If this works, we don't just get Stefan and Caroline back. We get your mother back. Aren't you even a little curious to see her?
I might know a few witches that could help.
I'm not helping you. (Tries to shut the door on his face but Damon puts his leg in between.)
Ow.
I hate Kai, and you know that, and the first thing you did when I got back was throw him in my face to fake apologize.
Yeah, and then I real apologized for being a dick.
And here you are less than 24 hours later asking me to work with him.

Bonnie, we need Kai to get to 1903, and we need Bennett bl*od to do the damn spell. Listen. We go in, we grab my mom, she flips Stefan's switch, he triggers Caroline, emotional dominoes, heyyyy! Everybody wins.
If I give you my bl*od, will you just get out of my face?
Probably... although I think you're gonna want to join us. Stick with me, Bonnie Bennett. I might just have the answer to all your prayers.
You want the 1903 Ascendant. Well, sure. Just let me reach in my pocket and pull it out.
If you're sincerely looking for a way to make up for the hell that you put me through, this is it.

OK. The problem is the Gemini kept the existence of the 1903 prison world a secret for generations, so find the key to that particular jail cell, I'd have to navigate ancient texts, undo layers of magical cloaking spells, and... Wait. (reaches into his pockets and pulls out the Ascendant) Oh, that's weird. Ha ha! It was in my pocket. When Damon told me about mama Salvatore, I started looking, and if I wanted to, (Bonnie reaches for the Ascendant, but Kai pulls his hand back) .. I could get her out. Newly minted leader of the Gemini coven and all, I don't even need a celestial event to zap us there. (sets the Ascendant on the table)
OK. So what's the catch?
I'll go if you go. Come on. It could be fun, you know, 1903, the... the Gilded Age. Didn't you ever dream about time travel?
I would rather die of cholera than spend an afternoon with you.

You're way more likely to die at the hands of your gal pal Caroline. I bet it will be over something stupid like she stops doing laundry, and you make some snippy comment, and she snips off your tongue. I'm mean, if only there were some way to reunite her with her humanity.

maybe there's somewhere 
 a lesson to learn 
 but that wouldn't change the fact 
 that wouldn't speed the time 
 once the foundation's cracked 
 and I'm 
 still hurting
Moving. Truly. Although it did lack a certain, um, authenticity.
What the hell are you doing? That was the director!
And you are a vampire without humanity, singing about heartbreak.
It's a performance, Stefan.

(as he speaks, he gets up and walks down the stairs towards the stage) It sure is, Caroline, especially this carefully crafted good student routine, straight and narrow, anything to keep you from making a mistake you might regret one year from now when you flip your switch back on. Oh, except the whole ruining my life part.
Well, if your humanity's off, then you shouldn't really care how I deal.
No, no, no. See, that's where you're wrong because like you, I'm prone to doing bad things when my humanity is off, but unlike you, I don't have an elaborate system to keep me in check.
Well that's not my problem.
Well, I'm making it your problem. If my life is gonna fall apart when my humanity starts flooding back, then so is yours. When I'm done with you, you'll be drowning in mistakes.
(walks toward Stefan) This is seriously about revenge?

Yes, it is, and this... (holds up his hands, which are covered in bl*od) .. this is a control freak's worst nightmare. This is me undoing your routine. This is me... (Stefan wipes bl*od onto Caroline's lips, causing her face to vamp out) .. forcing you to let go one day at a time until you break. (he leaves the auditorium)
Damn. Crocodile Dundee called. He wants his kn*fe back.
Yeah. You know, he's no longer a thing, and neither is that joke. (Damon walks in wearing a coat)
Ouch.
Is this presentable attire by 1903 standards?
Whoa. Who said you're coming?
To meet the woman who gave birth to the two epic loves of my life? Heh. Me.
Powerful as I am, there's a limit to how many people one witch can transport with this spell.
Which is why there's two of us. Shall we?
Fine. Let's go get mama.
Sangiema meam et nos mundo carcerema. Sangiema meam et nos mundo carcerema.
Well, isn't this a picturesque slice of hell?
You guys go ahead. Kai and I will start the locator spell on the Ascendant.
But Kai just had the Ascendant. Why do we have to find another one?
The Ascendant can't travel between worlds, which means we gotta find its mirror image here in 1903.
(sarcastically, as he zips up his jacket) Page 10 on the world-jumping rulebook. Shall we? (walks off)
I don't want to leave you alone with him.
I'll be fine. (Kai is catching snow on his tongue) He's good now, remember? New leaf. (she goes to join Damon)
New leaf? You believe me.
Hell no, but Damon and Elena need to meet his mom alone. So shut up and let's find the Ascendant. (holds up her hand)
Oh, sh**t. Is your bike OK? (Stefan gets off) Do you need money for the bus?
Seriously?
I just had to stuff the director's body into a furnace. Do you know how hard it was to get an audition during spring break?

Oh, come on. It was easy for you, Caroline. All you had to do was shed some tears about your mom's funeral, play the cancer card, and - boom - your precious routine is back on track. (gets down to put his bike back together) Am I wrong?
This is your only warning. Go away.
Neat, organized Caroline. Staying within the lines. Good at control, terrible at revenge.
I dismantled your bike.

I tore your director's head off with my teeth. Oh, my God. Caroline, literally just unbolt this damn thing? I mean, it's gonna take me, what, 10 minutes to put this back together? You are an embarrassment to humanity-free vampires everywhere.
OK. So I've got a few. You ready?
Actually, I thought about it, and anyone named Alaric should not be allowed to name another human.
Uh, I didn't name me.
True. OK. You can have veto power.
Good. Well, then I veto Duke.
Ha ha!
Uh, let me call you right back. (hangs up) What are you doing here?
Really hoping you got enough vervain to get blondie and her cohort from here to the Salvatore cellar without further drama.
You do realize I'm a human, right? Up against two vampires without remorse?
Ah. I see. Your girl has got a bun in the oven, and now you've gone all g*n. Vamp hearing.
You know, I'd actually like my child to grow up with a father.
Granted, a cowardly father. Probably play catch and run from the ball or go fishing an flee from the fish.
I have w*apon in my apartment.

Can we just take a second to acknowledge how insane it is that we're standing in the house that you grew up in? (Elena finds a tin-type photo of one of the brothers from when they were young children on the mantle and coos happily) Awww, Damon! (She picks up the photograph and examines it before showing it to Damon) You were so adorable!

Aww, thanks! (He looks at the photo and grimaces) Except... that's Stefan. (He sees another photo on the mantle of himself as a child with his mother and grabs it) This is me. (He pauses for a moment and stares at it before handing it over to Elena) We're not here to socialize. We get the Ascendant, we find my mother, and after she flips Stefan's switch, we figure out what the hell we're going to do with her.
(continues looking at the baby photo of Damon) Aw, you can give her another chance?
(snoops through the desk) Chance to what? Disarray another literal boatload of people?
Stefan was a Ripper. You never gave up on him.

And where was Lily from 1858 to 1903? She was blood-binge-ing through Europe while Stefan and I carried the loss. (Elena looks at him sympathetically) Not exactly maternal, Elena. Far as I'm concerned, my mother died when we buried her empty coffin. What we're looking for is just a tool to get my brother back.
(shocked) Damon?
(overwhelmed) Hello, mother.

There was a time I marked days on a calendar. (She joins them at the coffee table and pours them each a cup of tea before sitting across from them) I gave up after a few years, but, judging by your bizarre attire...
You've been in here for over a century...
(sarcastically) Yeah, I would have come by sooner, but I thought you were safe and sound in the family crypt. (He smiles fakely) My bad.
(smiles guiltily) Technically, I did die in 1858, after a nurse in the TB ward fed me vampire bl*od.
And you never thought to stop by and clear things up?
How did you end up here, Mrs. Salvatore?
(whispers) Mrs. Salvatore?
(whispers back) I don't know what to call her.

(chuckles) Please, call me Lily. (She sits down across from them again) It was October 31st, 1903. (She dips a tea bag into each of their cups. Next to the cups is a sealed jar of bl*od and a small dropper) I had just arrived in New York Harbor. The night sky was alive with this beautiful shimmering light. And, out of nowhere, a coven of witches attacked. When I woke, they were gone. Everyone was gone. (She chuckles nervously) That night, the sky danced with colors again, and it's done so every night since.
It's called "prison." You must have pissed off a lot of people.
(smiles) That life seems like forever ago.
You on a diet?

I depleted every slaughterhouse within walking distance, and every butcher's shop along the hellish trek from New York to Mystic Falls. (She picks up the jar of bl*od and shows it to them) This is the last of the bl*od here, heh. Two drops a week, just to stay awake.
That sounds miserable.
(smiles) I manage. (She looks at Damon) I heard you and your brother turned during the w*r.
Mmhmm.
(sips her tea) Your father must have been horrified.
He was! And then, Stefan ripped his throat out.
I apologize - that's cruel to laugh - but... good for Stefan. (Damon nods at her) I truly hated that man.
Oh, I know you did. So much so that you left your kids with him, faked your own death, and then went out to join the Ripper Coalition.
(smiles tightly) Well, it's nice to see that you've grown into yourself, Damon. (Damon smiles back, but Lily's smile falls quickly) How's your brother?
Hello? Is anyone there?
Damnit, Stefan! What do you want?
(pretends to grab a soda can) Uh, I brought you a little peace-offering. I figured with all that singing, and furnace-stuffing, you must be parched.
Now, see, this is how a vampire with no humanity is supposed to act! I am inflicting actual pain!
(groans) Leave me alone!
Why? You thinking about giving in? Letting go? Breaking your code?
Stefan, stop!
Come on, Caroline! Just let go! I promise it'll feel good.
I am not going to let you ruin my life.
Okay! Then I'll end it.
(shouts in pain) Ahh! Ahhh!
You have really nice palms.
Phesmatos tribum, nas ex veras, sequitas sanguinum. Phesmatos tribum, nas ex viras, sequitas sanguinum.
(blurts out) Do you know why I'm here?
Because my guilt keeps me up at night. (Bonnie continues to ignore him, and Kai sighs) I don't-I don't expect you to believe me. But I need you to give me one more chance.
Bonnie! LISTEN TO ME!
(guilty) Sorry, I... Oh my God, I didn't... I didn't mean to do that...
(cuts him off) But you did it anyway. Because even if you're telling the truth, the old you is still inside of you. (She glares at him) The Ascendant is this way.
(confused) And, you believe I can reconnect Stefan with his humanity?
The last memory Stefan has of you is a vision of an angel telling him "Everything is going to be okay."
So, you're gonna be an angel again. He doesn't need to how how screwed-up you really are.
Of course I'll help! I'd love nothing more than to see him again.
(smacks the table and stands up) Pack your bags.
(stands up as well) Wonderful! (She laughs in excitement) I'll alert the others, hmm?
You'll alert who, now?
You knew so much about me, I assumed you'd heard of my traveling companions?
(uneasy) What traveling companions?
Everyone, meet my son Damon. He's here to take us home.
There you are! Definite role-model material.
(incredulously) Damon really spent five years in a cell with you without k*ll himself?
Oh, a fellow smart-ass. I see why you were his drinking buddy. Oh, you're gonna have to knock-off the hard stuff while you're breastfeeding, mate.
(annoyed) You know, what are you even doing here? I thought you hated Stefan.
Yeah, I do. In fact, I have a whole elaborate revenge-scheme against him. But, unfortunately, in order to truly hurt someone, they have to care.
So, you want Stefan's humanity back just to remind him how much you two hate each other?
(shrugs) A game's more fun with two players.

You know, last night, an innocent girl had an involuntary splenectomy because you brought her into your life. (Enzo sighs and rolls his eyes) Now, if this is your idea of fun? You need to take a long look in the mirror, pal.
And what? Reevaluate my flippant disregard for human life?
(smirks) Nah, just your deep, obvious loneliness.

(impressed) Oh, got me there! Yeah, I'm just a sad nobody, up to no good, while you're at home ticking off your life milestones. (He starts counting on his fingers as he speaks) Girl, kid, death. Heh. (His voice becomes bitter) Sounds lovely.
What are you doing?
(annoyed) What are you doing? It's called "spring break."
It's called practice. (She notices that Stefan has a piece of wood in his stomach and becomes alarmed) Is he okay?
(sighs in annoyance and walks toward the girl) He's fine.
(frustrated) Nice going, you jackass!
Second lesson in losing control: No... Saving... Strangers.

(compels her) Go to your room. I'll deal with you later. (As the girl runs away, Caroline addresses Stefan) So, to summarize, "letting go" means being an idiot, increasing your chances of getting caught, and worst of all, actively making choices...
Shhh. Shhh.
Uhhh, Enzo?
(sighs) Bollocks.
These vampires have been trapped here with you? The whole time?
We went everywhere together. They happened to be on the boat that night, poor souls.
(in disbelief) These... poor souls... don't happen to have the same affinity for rolling heads, do they?

On the contrary, these people saved me from that part of myself. I was banished here because I was a monster. I drank with no remorse from whatever human I could sink my teeth into. But, locked in this cage, I was forced to confront the animal I had become. (She affectionately straightens up the handkerchief in one of her male friends' pockets) And, as we ran out of resources, my friends sacrificed their rations for me. And, I knew if I drank everything, as every bone in my body demanded, there wouldn't be enough to wake them. So, I learned to control my bloodlust, for them. These people made me feel human again.
I'll fetch the rest of the bl*od so we can revive them.
Not only is she a Ripper... (He lowers his voice to a whisper) .. she's an insane Ripper!
Or, maybe she feels responsible for them?
(continues to whisper) What, are you kidding me? Vampire dollhouse?
Damon! Isn't this the Ascendant?
(nods awkwardly) Yeah.
(opens the Ascendant) Why isn't Bonnie here?
(sighs and speaks quietly) Because Bonnie isn't looking for the Ascendant, Elena.
The spell feels stronger. The Ascendant must be around here somewhere.
(confused) Why would the Ascendant be here?
I don't know, I didn't put it here.

If you don't think I'm capable of change, why spend an entire day with me? Why bring me out into the middle of nowhere? (Bonnie looks uncomfortable, and doesn't turn around to face him) I could gut you all over again. Your friends would never even hear you scream.
(sighs and finally turns to face him) Because maybe you're right. Maybe, deep down, there's a part of me that believes there's a sliver of good in you.
(laughs) And, you'd be right! (He continues to laugh and walks past her) Looking, looking, and... nope, they didn't hide the Ascendant in a random pile of...
Bonnie!
(panting) What are you doing?
Gaining your trust, and then stabbing you in the back? Feels pretty sucky, doesn't it?
(pleads) Please, don't.

(angrily) Don't what? Don't-don't leave you here? All alone? Drive you to the point of wanting to end your own life? (She completely loses her temper and shouts at the top of her lungs) I almost k*ll myself because of you!
(terrified) Please, please, believe me! I've changed!
(holding the kn*fe up above him) I know. I know. (She grits her teeth) So have I.
At least they're still breathing.
Aw, Damon must be up to something really good if he sent the B-team. (He picks up another broken piece of wood off of the floor and waves it in the air) What do you say we send them a little message?

Stopping you from leaving the cleaning staff two dead bodies. Not to mention, k*ll Elena's former guardian and your brother's best friend. Did you like being locked up and tortured to get your humanity back?

(laughs patronizingly) It must be so exhausting, over-thinking everything. (He walks toward her) Denying your own urge to k*ll. (He pushes his chest right up against the end of the sh**t r*fle) Just be done with them.
(cocks her g*n and glares at him) Back. Away.
(sighs in disappointment) Fine. If that's what you want.
...Hey!
Where are you going?
You think I don't know everything about you? I taught you how to control your bloodlust, remember? (Stefan flips the girl around so she's facing him and compels her) Stay still, and don't scream.
(unamused) What are you doing?
The thing that you keep resisting.
If you're trying to tempt me, it's not working.

I don't have to try. Deep down, you and I are exactly the same, Caroline. Come on, you can break routine for a second, right? (He spins the girl, who is swaying on the feet, around so she's facing Caroline. His hand is holding the girl's head to the side so her throat is bared to her, and he smiles cutely at her) She has a really pretty neck.
Your vampire-menagerie is going to have to take the next train out. We're down a witch.
(in disbelief) You want to leave them behind? No, Damon, you can't save me without saving them.
We'll come back for them. Promise. Let's go.
Damon, look outside! Is that the Aurora Borealis?
Also known as our ticket out of here. (She looks at Elena) You got it?
Yeah!
(takes the Ascendant) Okay.
(notices Lily has vanished) You gotta be kidding me! (He looks at the girls, clearly frustrated, and sighs) Go. Start the damn spell. I'll go get her.
Time to wake up!
No!
I said, they're not coming.
What have you done?
We'll see them after the reunion. Let's go.
You don't understand, Damon. I will not leave them!
Too bad.
They're my family! (Damon looks at her, extremely hurt by these words) These people are my family.
(looks around for a moment) These freaks may be your family, but Stefan Salvatore is mine, and if you don't want to help him, I will leave you here to rot! (Lily looks torn) Do you understand me?
(chanting) Sangiema meam et nos mundo carcerema. Sangiema meam et nos mundo carcerema.
Damon!
(shouts) Bonnie!
Nice neglige!
(laughs) Enzo. Hey. Um, did I call you last night? I have a text from you to meet up, but I don't remember ever seeing you.
Look, Sarah... It was a mistake bringing you into my life.
(confused) Then, why did you?

(chuckles) Call it deep and obvious loneliness. (He sighs) Look, the truth is, you've been a pawn in a game that I've now lost interest in playing. But, you're no ordinary girl, Sarah Salvatore. You deserve better.
(puzzled) Sarah... Salvatore? Why would you call me that?
Oh, boy. This is bad.
(rubs his eyes) What?
(seriously) I'm marrying an idiot. (She roughly smacks him in the shoulder, and Alaric groans in pain) You could died today!
As opposed to any other day?

Eighteen years. That's how long I need you to be alive. Help me raise this baby. Then we can send him or her into the world, and you can run around with g*n, and vampires, and be an idiot. (Her voice becomes quiet) Okay?
(smiles) Fine.
(about the computer) Whole world runs on those things. The sooner you learn 'em, the better.
Maybe you could teach me?
(makes the bed) That's more Stefan's thing. But, he can give you a tutorial after you mother him back to sanity.

(walks toward Damon) Stefan was right. The night of my funeral, an angel did visit him: me. (Damon looks at her in surprise) I had just turned, and... I wanted to see my boys. But, when I leaned down to whisper into Stefan's ear, the hunger surged. All I could hear was the pulse in his veins, all I could smell was the bl*od. So, I fled. For your sake. And, no matter how deeply you felt my absence, it is half as deep as I felt yours.
(nods in understanding) Good to know. (He pauses for a moment) I'll let you get some sleep.
Damon?
(sighs) Yes?
As much as I am looking forward to us getting to know each other again, I fear that I can't truly be myself until we retrieve the ones that I've left behind.
Oh.
When will we be going back?
Soon, but don't worry, your prison world's not going anywhere.
(panting) Where do they keep their food?

(startled) Oh, crap! (Once Kai gets over his initial fright, he looks closer at the three men and three women sitting frozen at the table. He then makes the mistake of leaning close to the partially-awakened vampire at the end of the table and chuckles) Who the hell are... AHHHHH!
You better check the inventory of the bl*od cooler before Lily wakes up.
(smiles and turns to face him) You have her eyes.
You brought that back?
(takes the photo back) It's the only baby picture of my boyfriend in existence! Of course I brought it back.
(snatches the photo again) Give me that!
I liked seeing that side of you today.
(gives her a look) Disappointed and disillusioned? You see that every day.
(puts her arms around Damon's neck and plays with his hair) A mother's son.
She's just a means to get Stefan back.
Look, I know that she's not the woman that you remember, but... give her some time!
You're lucky you're so adorable, because your eternal optimism is super annoying.
Well, I happen to know from experience that it's never a waste of time to look for the good in someone.
This woman left her kids to go be the den mother to a family of vampires. I think we're going to be looking for quite a while.
Well, then it's a good thing we have forever!
Ahhh. That wasn't terrible.
See? Control is overrated.
I don't even remember how we got back to my room. (She peeks under the sheet and realizes she's still naked) Where's my shirt?
It's... next to the girl we left bleeding out in the hallway.
You're right. Your way is much more fun.
Oh hey, Bon-Bon.
(sheepishly) Sorry. Awkward timing.
No, no, no, no, it's fine. I, um, I actually have to go check in on Ric to see how things are going with Stefan and Caroline, so...
This better be good.
I just wanted to thank you for helping me find closure today.
(points upstairs) You know there's a crazy-lady up there who wants to open that prison world up more than anything, right?
(whispering) We're never going back there, right?
No! We're not!
(turns off the faucet) Good. Because I have something for you. A gift from 1994. I was gonna give it to you yesterday, but then you acted like an ass and you didn't deserve it.
(sighs) Well, I...
That's not what I think it is... is it?

If it wasn't for your notes on the map of Nova Scotia, I would have never remembered there was magic on that island. There's a good chance that I wouldn't be here today. So, for my 1994 road trip, I got you a li'l something.
The cure. The cure to vampirism.
(smiles) I knew you were planning on getting it yourself, you had the whole route mapped down to the kilometer.
(closes the box) Why are you giving me this?
Because my mom's surprisingly happy as a vampire, and because I have full faith that we'll get Caroline back to normal the old-fashioned way. But mostly, because I knew you wanted it for Elena.
(stunned) What if I don't want it for her now?
That's none of my business. I'm just finishing what you started. You can give it to her, or not. (She places her hand on top of Damon's affectionately) It's up to you.
If Stefan wants to save Sarah's life, all he has to do is shut his humanity off.
Stefan without his humanity is one artery away from Stefan the ripper.
Your mother is alive?
In a prison world of 1903.
(confused) And you believe that I can reconnect Stefan with his humanity?
(smacks the table and stands up) Pack your bags.
(stands up as well) Wonderful! (She laughs in excitement) I'll alert the others, hmm?
She has a vampire dollhouse.
They're not coming.
They are my family.
I will leave you here to rot. We'll come back for them.
(whispering) We're never going back there, right?
No! We're not!
You've been a pawn in a game that I've now lost interest in playing. You're no ordinary girl, Sarah Salvatore.
Why would you call me that?
I have something for you.
The cure to vampirism.
I knew you wanted it for Elena.
(stunned) What if I don't want it for her now?
(weirded out) OK...
(annoyed) Oh, come on. (He walks toward the bar) OK, who's messing with me? Chris, are you up there? (He pauses, but gets no answer) Dick.
(horrified) Oh, God. Chris? Chris?
Boo.
(scoffs) Are you booing me?
Boo!
(indignant) I scared him. (She turns to the bartender) I scared you, right, with the whole chair flippy and the bottle thing?
(scared) Who are you people?
Oh! I'm Caroline... (She gestures to Stefan, who waves to him) .. this is Stefan. (She points to Chris' body) And that... Mmm... was delicious. (She turns to Stefan) Taste.
(happily) Mmm.
...What's going on?
Well, Caroline and I had a little bet that she would scare you to death.
(interrupts him) Like, literally scare you to death.
But you have to understand this is her first time messing with somebody, so she didn't realize the whole dead body shock-drop thing is a complete cliche.
(angrily) Cliche? This guy was my friend.
Well, then why aren't you freaking out, a panic attack, heart attack? Come on, give me something.
(compels him) I don't think you heard me. You're having a heart attack.
(scoffs) What are you... (He starts to groan and cough painfully) My... my chest. What's happening?
(drolly) She's cheating. That's what's happening.
(gasps) Ugh. Please help me.
(sighs) All right. Just relax. It's mental. You only think you're having a heart attack.
(mockingly) Now your throat's tightening. (She grabs her own throat and fake coughs as the bartender grabs his throat and gags) You can't breathe.
Oh, my God! Are those spiders all over your body?
(happily) Hmm. Look at that. I won. Poor guy was so scared that he died of a heart attack.
(indignant) No, that's not fair. Technically, he died of a loophole.
A win is a win. So, you know what we do now?
(sighs and grumbles) Yes, unfortunately I do. Karaoke.
So you drag me out of a hospital bed, waste a t*nk of gas driving around all night just to bring me to a house in the middle of nowhere?
(sighs) As soon as this door opens, you are not my problem anymore.
When have I ever been your problem?
Since your great-great-great uncle Stefan nearly got you k*ll.
(confused) What?
It's time for you to meet your real family.
Hello? Are you looking for my son?
(gulps nervously) My mistake.
I'm sorry, have... have we...
(quickly cuts her off) I've got the wrong house. Heh. Terribly sorry to disturb you.
What the hell was that?
I've met that woman before, in 1903.
(incredulously) What?!
She's the one who turned me into a vampire.
Do you smell something?
(inhales) Hmm. Mom's cooking.
Is that bacon?
Yeah, or some baby she abducted from a nearby village.
(giggles) Hey. Shh, she can hear us. You have to give her a chance, just like I gave you one. She's your mother.

No, she is a tool to get Stefan's humanity back, because there is no doubt that he and Caroline are fangs-deep in bodies right now. So, the sooner we get our supernatural-born k*ll out of circulation, the better.
Have you seen my t-shirt?
(smirks) I prefer you without one.
I'm not so sure your mom would feel the same way.
(shrugs) Take mine.
Wow!
(smiles) This was always Damon's favorite... "Eggie in baskie."
(takes a bite) Doesn't taste like I remember.
Well, you were human the last time you tasted it. Our tastes change over time. But, Elena, you're fairly new at this, aren't you?
(nods) I turned a few years ago.
You ever miss it, being human?
(shrugs) Sometimes.
So if I understood correctly, um, in order to free my companions from that place where I was trapped, we'll need the magical device.
The Ascendant.
Yes. The Ascendant. Where is that?
(awkwardly) Safe. Very safe.
And we'll also need a celestial event.
We'll have to do some digging, yeah. Be patient, they take time. They're very rare.
There's a full moon coming up. Will that work? If not, the Lyrids meteor shower is in two weeks.
(sarcastically) Well, look at you. If you're not a one-woman "Farmer's Almanac".
Actually, I took your advice, and I've been dabbling on Stefan's computer. What a wondrous invention... All that knowledge.
And videos of cats riding robot vacuum cleaners.
(concerned) Everything OK?
It's Jo. Someone's been attacking people at Whitmore.
(sighs) Let me guess... One of them's blond, and the other one liked turning people into human pez dispensers.
That's exactly what I'm gonna find out. (She stands and turns to Lily with an apologetic smile) Thank you so much for breakfast.
Who is that woman, and how do you even know who my family is? How do I not know this?

Because your uncle Stefan compelled you to forget to keep you a secret from your other uncle, Damon, after he k*ll your parents, and you would have shared their fate had it not been for your other uncle.
(horrified) That's who you were taking me to?
Well, actually, no. The good brother recently went bad, and I was hoping to leave you in the care of the bad brother, who actually is less bad now than the good brother.
(stunned) I don't understand any of this.

Yeah. Look. I can try repeating it, luv, but it won't be any clearer the second time. (Sarah sighs, clearly overwhelmed, and looks out the passenger window) Look. You wanted to know who that woman is? She's the most dreadful person I've ever met.
Unh! No sick passengers!
I have a ticket. I've paid.
(takes the ticket and rips it up) Oh, yeah? Well, we're not running a sick ward.
(coughing and gasping) There's a doctor on that ship. He can help me.
(sneers) Get lost, mate, before you infect us all with your consumption.
(frightened) Who are you?
Someone who sees you need a doctor.
(laughs defeatedly) Well, I... I appreciate that, but even if I could get past quarantine, I seem to have lost my ticket.
I can be of some help with that. Come. We don't have much time.
I thought I was on my way to a new life, aided by the classiest woman I'd ever met. By the time the ship docked in New York harbor, every soul on board was dead, including me.
(compels her) You're going to forget everything you know about your real family. You're going to wake up safe in your dorm, having forgotten you ever heard the name Salvatore.
Or you're finally gonna tell me the whole story.
(sighs in annoyance) You're on vervain.
Yeah. Your friend Matt stopped by the hospital and gave me some.
Unh.

Well, you're a real tough cookie 
 With a long history 
 Of breaking little hearts like the one in me 
 That's ok, let's see how you do it 
 Put up your dukes, and let's get down to it 
 Hit me with your best sh*t 
 Why don't you hit me with your best sh*t? 
 Hit me with your best sh*t
Hey, Taylor Swift. We're trying to study here. (Caroline smiles and wags her finger at the girl, who scoffs) Where's the manager in this place?
Someone ask for the manager?
(indignant) I didn't break his ribs. He got the wind knocked out of him.
Guy was out for 20 seconds.
(shrugs) Maybe he's not cut out for a tactical training program. We're not there to bust up keggers.
(laughs) You want some food?
(corrects him) You want some food, "Officer Lockwood"?
(shakes his head) Dork.

Hit me with your best sh*t 
 Why don't you hit me with your best sh*t? 
 Come on, hit me with your best sh*t 
 Fire away-ay
(warily) What did we just walk into?
Oh, look. It's the police officers in training. Are you guys here to arrest us? (He points the kn*fe at the girl and compels her) You can go away now.
(horrified) What the hell are you doing?
I'm just enjoying the music. You guys want next song?
We should get out of here.
No. Stay. Caroline's taking requests.
Here. Text Elena. Tell her we're headed to campus to check it out. (Lily looks at him in confusion) See those letters? Think of it as a tiny typewriter.
Oh. You're right.
Mm-hmm.
"My Dearest Elena, I hope this finds you well..."
No, no. Short and sweet. Just "Headed to campus." (Lily gives him a puzzled look) Yeah. Then, when we find them, I'll take care of Caroline, you look Stefan right in the eyes...
(narrates as she types) And I will return him to the man he used to be.
Exactly.
And once we've done that, then we will go rescue my friends?
Sure. I know how terribly concerned you are about that.
(continues typing) How shall I end it? With an, "I love you?"
Knock yourself out.
You do love her, don't you?
Not that that's any of your business, but, yes, I do. And she loves me. We're in the love.
(quietly) And you're afraid you'll ruin all that if you give her the cure. (Damon gives her a shocked look) Last night, when your friend Bonnie was over...
You spied on me?
Well, I didn't mean to eavesdrop. I'm just not used to hearing other voices. I...
(exasperated) Really?
Couldn't help but listen, and it's not every day that one hears something so rare as the cure for vampirism.
(grimaces) Well, let's not bring this up to anyone else, OK?
You mean, don't bring it up with Elena.
I don't even know if she wants the cure.

Yet you fear she might and that if you give it to her you'll lose her. (Damon sh**t her another look) We're more alike than you care to admit, Damon. Neither of us can bear the thought of being alone.
He's unconscious, but I gave him some of my bl*od, and his vitals have stabilized.
(worried) The more these v*ctim pile up, the harder it is to hide the reason they're here.
Yeah, I know. That's why I'm hoping that Damon and his mom find them soon.
(confused) I'm sorry. Did you just say Damon's mom? Isn't she dead?
(slowly) No. She was trapped in a 1903 prison world, where Kai is currently trapped.
(stunned) Kai is in a 1903 prison world?
(guiltily) I'm sorry. Has nobody told you this?
I'm on hour 13 of a 12-hour shift. Maybe someone could have sh*t me a text?
(even more guilty) I'm... sorry.
So, Kai's gone?
(smiles) As in for good.
Oh, that's amazing news. Like, really amazing news.
(shocked) You're pregnant.
(smiles) I was wondering why you switched to decaf, especially while working a 13-hour shift.
The last thing this baby needs is an uncle Psychopath.
You and Alaric are having a baby. I... (Jo laughs excitedly again, and Elena pulls her into a hug) Jo, this is... this is amazing. I... I'm so happy for you!
(impressed) Little old you did all this? (He sighs) You've made a mistake.

I know, starting with trusting my vampire stalker, who arranged for me to befriend some blue-eyed bartender, all so I could witness him getting run over, and you playing the part of the hero. (Enzo looks surprised) While you were sleeping, I went through your phone, saw your texts to Matt.
Well, that saves me an awkward conversation.
(unamused) I am such an idiot for ever trusting you.
Don't b*at yourself up. I remember what it was like to be so naive.
The bacilli have spread to most of your lungs, carving out cavities in the tissue. The bleeding will continue.
(weakly) You can stop it?
I believe so, but the dosage required at this late stage is expensive.
Payment isn't an issue, provided your curative is effective.
I can assure you it is.
(compels him) How many people have you saved with this? Be truthful.
(dazed) None. I promise them health and sell them lavender mixed with castor oil.
What? Why are you saying that? I thought you could help me.
(unhappily) He lied. (She compels the doctor again) What is this man's true prognosis?
He'll die within the week. Chances are, he'll never see land again.
(furious) Leave us.
You should go as well. I do not wish to repay your acts of kindness by affecting you.
You can't. I've already had consumption.
(confused) How did you survive?
I didn't.
What are you, an angel?
Ha ha ha!
(annoyed) Look. We listened to you sing, we clapped our hands. Can we go now?
Let's play Caroline Trivia.
I don't even know what that is.
Oh, sure you do! You both dated me, which means you should know everything about me, so I'm gonna ask you some questions about myself, and whoever answers them right lives.
You're sick.
(ignores him) When is my birthday? Tyler!
(sighs) October 10.
Very good. Alright, Matt. Your turn. What is my favorite color?
That's a trick question. You don't have a favorite color.
(laughs) Correct! Ha ha ha! OK, now a tiebreaker. Whoever answers first wins. What was my mom's final memory before she died?
(frustrated) How would we even begin to know that?
Oh, I'm sure I mentioned it at some point.
No, you didn't.
(shrugs) Come on. Ticktock, ticktock. Judges are waiting for a final answer. What was my mom's final memory before she kicked the bucket?
Well, looks like, uh, Whitmore's gonna need a new philosophy T.A. (He looks over at Caroline) Hmm. Your mom was teaching you how to ride a bike.
(excitedly) Bingo! And Stefan wins, which means you two lose, which isn't that bad actually because now it just means we get to k*ll the both of you.
Judging from the v*ctim, they started at the library, they took out a couple security guards near the football field, and then they wandered over to the movie theater.
(exasperated) You know what the most shocking part of all this is? I'm not shocked.
Doctor 101... Becoming desensitized goes with the territory.

Actually, the reason why I'm not shocked is because I've been in their shoes, and I was just as bad, and this is all just one big horrible reminder that there's always gonna be a part of me that's capable of doing what they're doing.
(sympathetically) But you're not gonna let that happen. You're gonna be too busy running your small-town family practice and curing little Stevie from the chicken pox.
For a while maybe until little Stevie becomes teenage Steven and I haven't aged a day.
Have you told Damon about this?
(confused) What do you mean?
I saw how you reacted when you found out I was pregnant.
(embarrassed) Well, I...
(cuts her off) And the next eternity of your life flashed before your eyes, and it scared the hell out of you.
I... I'm just happy for you and Alaric.
Alaric, who used to be a vampire, now is a human having a kid. Have you discussed this with your boyfriend?
He knows how I feel, but he also knows that there's nothing we can do to change that, so there's no point in dwelling.
OK.
So how do I know you're not the one who's been mind-controlling me, making me believe this messed up family history?

You were ripped from the womb of a dead woman. Stefan compelled away the truth, but the emotional scars still linger. How else do you explain your morbid fascinations, hmm? (He looks around her room at all the different artwork hanging on her walls) The... the hanging of Mary Surratt... heh... is hardly a motivational poster, now is it?
Yeah. Well, there's mething about death that I find... I don't know...
(finishes her sentence) Alluring? Well, let me tell you, you can't truly appreciate death until you've stood at its precipice.
I haven't heard that song since I was a boy.
(smiles) I know.
Why are you doing this?
Is it so hard to believe someone could do you a kindness?
I was abandoned at a workhouse at the age of 4. It was not a place known for its kindness.

I, too, know what it is to be tossed aside like rubbish. I was sent to a sanatorium to rot, left to die, abandoned by my own husband, who prayed the end would come quickly not so that I would be spared pain and misery but so that he would be unburdened by me, but I was given a reprieve, and it was only once I was unshackled from a life that didn't want me that I found my true family.
Is that where you're heading, to meet them?
(smiles) No. I could never bear to be apart from them. They're here, traveling with me. Like you and I, they're outcasts. You could join us. You'd never be alone again.
It would appear the end is coming.
(smiles comfortingly) Or the beginning.
Drink this, Lorenzo.
If your brother's on the hunt, he won't be staying in one place.

Yeah? Well, we have to start somewhere. Elena said she treated some kid who was attacked coming out of modern European history. (He pauses for a moment when he receives a text message from Elena to update him on what she knows) Well, well. Mother knows best. Elena said they're at Scull Bar. Come on.
(anxiously) We have yet to discuss what we'll do if Stefan fails to remember me.
(confused) What, are you kidding? You're his mother. Of course he's gonna remember you. (He stops and looks her in the eye) Tell me you can do this.
What if I say the wrong thing? A century and a half is a long time to be away.
You'll be fine. (He starts to walk away toward the bar, and Lily follows behind him) Just channel whatever you were feeling when you came back to get us.
(puzzled) When I came back to get you?
Yeah. 1903. You found out we were vampires, you landed in New York harbor after a 40-year romp in Europe, and you...
Oh. You weren't coming to get us.
(embarrassed) No. I wasn't. I'm sorry.
You can do this. All we have to do is just try.

I have been trying, Damon. Since I laid my eyes on you yesterday, I have been trying with all of my heart to reconnect with the woman who was your mother, to remember what it felt like to mourn you and your brother after I was banished by your father. After I was turned, the only thing more powerful than the longing I felt for you was the fear of what I would I do if I ever saw you again. So I stayed away. I had to find others who could help me find my way back myself, and... By the time my new family helped me to do that, everything I felt for my old family, for you and your brother was gone. I hate that I can't make myself feel more. I'm so sorry.
(to Stefan) Heads, I k*ll Tyler, and tails, I k*ll Matt. Deal?
Sounds good to me.
Ooh! Looks like somebody's angry.
(rolls her eyes) He's a wolf. It's his resting face.
You wonder why everyone hates vampires? Look at you, messing with people for no reason. That's really brave.
What are you doing?
(laughs) Are you serious?
